We blink 15 times in a minute, 900 times in an hour, 21600 times in a day,  7884000 times in a year. An average Canadian lives for about 81 years, so 7884000 x 81 years = 638604000 times in our lifetime. Now, a blink lasts for about 0.3 seconds, so 638604000 x 0.3 = 191581200 seconds spent blinking. Divide that by 86400, and then by 365, and you get roughly 6 years of our life wasted because of blinking. In other words, we spend 6 years of our life in darkness. Try sleeping with your eyes open.
